rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {BUS3800, BUS5800, ETX3011, ETX9520}
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETX1100} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

description: This unit presents the basis techniques of quantitative risk analysis. Risk identification and measurement techniques most commonly used in industry are discussed, including descriptive statistics. The basic rules of probability are presented in practical contexts and as the foundation for the study of probability distributions - themselves the foundations of risk analysis models. Finally, spreadsheet models of practical situations are developed and evaluated, using simulation methods.
